reviews.title: Unbeatable service
reviews.text: Just got back from a week at the Santorini Princess where the service, location and breath taking views took my breath away. Quite literally a stunning vista every which way you turned from all the hotel rooms and public terraces overlooking the Caldera. Away from the main hub of Thira, the hotel is still near enough to walk there with gorgeous tavernas and cafes en route to stop off at to enjoy the view with a bottle of great Santorini wine. What has to be mentioned though is the truly unbeatable service - the staff knock the spots off most of the worlds best hotels despite being a small hotel with only 16 rooms. They were discreet yet always nearby if you ever needed anything, a cold drink or just your sun lounger moving a few inches. This hotel is Greece's best kept secret and I cannot recommend it enough. You are treated like a princess from the minute you arrive till they wave you off to the airport. Forget the old days of simply Greece, this is simply luxurious with fine wines and fine dining food that puts most London restaurants to shame. Go!

We stay there in April 06 and enjoy every moment in this hotel. Firstly the room is very spacious, very good amenity and the view from our room is to die for(no. 12) with swimming pool on the door step and the view of the cadela(?) after that. Eventhough the hotel was half occupied but I hardly see anyone which made it so peaceful and calm. Secondly the staff is very attentive and friendly. They will make sure that you have everything you need. Last but not least, the music that they play around the hotel and pool area is excellent, very chill out, very relaxing. You won't be disappointed if you stay in this hotel. 5 star.

reviews.title: its all true

reviews.text: Our arrival at the Santorini Princess was heavenly, we were greeted by a warm friendly professional staff (dressed in white) who gave us a tour of the hotel. There were handshakes and welcomes from everyone we encountered. Our room was exquisite, bright, airy, clean, and surprise....a bottle of wine was waiting for us in our room, and in addition, we were presented with a "Welcome" glass of champagne! The views were incredible!! The sunsets! This is the place to see them! We met Achilleas one of the owners who was extremely helpful. He has a wonderful eye for detail. As busy as he was, he took time to stop and inquire as to our needs, and in the evening he was interested to hear about our day time adventures. He was quick to smile, and would offer suggestions of places to visit, or where to stop for a light snack. He was a true professional who not only treated us as specail guests, but almost like family too. We wouldnt hesitate to go back. If anyone is thinking Santorini, think Santorini Princess, it's the place to stay!
reviews.title: "Princess Paradise"
Fantastic place to stay
reviews.text: June, 2006 - we have just returned from a 4 week vacation which included 12 days on the Greek Islands. We spent 3 nights at the Santorini Princess a luxury spa hotel. It was magnificant - the views - overlooking the Caldera - the hospitality, service, food and wine is nothing but the best. We were looked after by the two brothers Achilleas & Alexandros Tsiaras, owners of the hotel, who went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. We were 3 couples travelling to celebrate a major birthday and everything was just perfect. Check out their website Santorini-princess and if you decide to stay there you definitely won't be disappointed. Santorini island is a must, if you only have time to visit one Greek Island then make it this one.

In planning our trip, we read many reviews for hotels in Santorini and determined that the Santorini Princess was the place to be! Let me say, it is definitely the ONLY place to stay in Santorini! As the name indicates - the “Princess” absolutely treats you like royalty! From the moment we arrived, it was special - - the escorted tour of the hotel, the bottle of wine in our room, the welcoming glass of champagne, the wonderful rooms and jacuzzi tub, the facilities, the beautiful terraced sitting areas and alcoves, dinner at the restaurant (the stuffed octopus is wonderful!), and the most dedicated and attentive staff you can imagine- - all this in addition to the most incredible view!
reviews.title: Heaven On Earth

reviews.text: In setting up our reservations, we corresponded with Achilleas (one of the owners). He was so helpful and accommodating that we were looking forward to meeting him upon our arrival. We really enjoyed chatting with him on our patio and at the pool, as he was extremely friendly and helpful during our entire stay. He truly cares about his guests and is committed to their comfort and certainly goes the “extra mile” to ensure that everyone has the most enjoyable stay possible. We ate at the hotel one night and commented to Achilleas the next day how much we enjoyed the Greek music and wanted to purchase the CD. When we saw him later in the day, he gave us a CD that he had burned of the music at the restaurant! This was truly special - for him to take the time to burn a CD for us certainly shows the level of commitment that he has to his guests! I cannot think of another hotel that provides the service and commitment that Achilleas and his bother do at the Santorini Princess! And the entire staff is wonderful - - most attentive, yet not intrusive.

We stayed at the Santorini Princess at the end of May 2006 for the last week of our honeymoon. We were lavished with attention from the moment we arrived, with a personal tour of the hotel and facilities and introduction to all the key staff. The hotel only has 22 rooms, so by the end of our stay, all of the hotel staff recognised us and we felt that we were more than just hotel guests.
reviews.title: Pure bliss
A must for all travellers
reviews.text: We were allocated Room 25, the upstairs room at the furthest end of the hotel, which afforded complete privacy and spectacular views of the caldera and Oia. We had a bottle of champagne welcoming us in our room. Within 5 minutes of arriving, we were treated to complimentary cocktails, just in time for the magnificent sunset. The views from every part of the hotel are truly breathtaking.

reviews.title: Absolutely Loved the Santorini Princess!
reviews.text: And the service... The staff are there to cater for your every whim. From the moment you lay eyes on one of the poolside sunlounges, you are offered a towel. We were regularly treated to complimentary cocktails and various culinary creations from the kitchen while we were poolside. And Alex and Achilles were always very helpful with suggestions of places to go and the best ways to get around the island.

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.text: We ate in the hotel restaurant on one of the nights, after some not so subtle suggestive comments made to us during our introductory tour. The food was very nice, but a little on the pricey side compared to what you will pay for a meal in Oia or Fira. But it is very convenient.

Some minor peeves: the toiletries were not replenished at all during our stay. There is a kitchenette but it is poorly equipped (e.g. no jug, toaster) - perhaps a ruse designed to encourage guests to eat at the restaurant. There is no shower; simply a spa bath with a European-style hand-held showerhead. As mentioned above, the restaurant is very nice but pricey - the 15 euro buffet breakfast was fairly average and we expected much more having regard to the asking price. But these irritations were minor compared with the enjoyment we had during our stay.

reviews.title: Great stay - overall

reviews.text: We stayed at the princess May 20-28th. Overall I'm glad we stayed there, but if we came back we would stay in Oiai as there was a little more choice of places to walk to, eat at, and soak up the atmosphere. The hotel was beautiful, the pool was immaculate and the service flawless. The owners were really helpful in recommending places to eat and knowledgeable about the area. On the downside though, the beds are rock hard. Very uncomfortable as they had absolutely no give to them. The owner said that they were orthorpedic mattresses and good for your back to be hard. That only applies if you're sleeping on your back, not your side as most people do. My husband is a chiropractor b.t.w! The other thing that I didn't see anyone comment on in the other reviews is that the food really [---]. They do not serve a lick of Greek food in the restaurant. Not even a Greek salad for lunch. We had just come from Tuscany, and didn't feel like eating pseudo Italian food cooked by a Greek chef. But everything was very expensive and what we did try was mediocre at best, although the service and ambience at the restaurant was nice. We tried having lunch by the pool and ordered burgers medium rare, thinking you can't go wrong with that. But what we got was 2 dried up patties approx 1/4 inch thick in a bun with lettuce and tomato. It meant that we had to leave the hotel for lunch and dinner which was inconveneint with a small child. So overall, if you aren't fussy about good food and don't mind not eating much Greek food then this is a perfect place to stay!
